article.text: 10:28AM BST 28 May 2012 Speaking during a joint news conference with his Russian counterpart, foreign secretary William Hague said Russia and Britain agreed Kofi Annan's peace plan was "at the moment the only hope" for resolving Syria's crisis and that Russia had an important role to play. Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov said Moscow was deeply alarmed by the massacre in the Syrian town of Houla, but added it was clear both President Bashar al-Assad's government and rebels were to blame. "We are dealing with a situation in which both sides evidently had a hand in the deaths of innocent people," Lavrov said.
